intro: Acer virens, commonly known as the green ash, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its finely serrated leaves that turn a striking yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a broad, spreading canopy. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
